item.title: Hiroshima marks 80 years of the atomic bomb in a context of conflict
item.description: Japan will mark on Wednesday the 80th anniversary of the launch of the atomic bomb over Hiroshima in a context of appeals to abandon nuclear weapons and wars in Ukraine and the Middle East. On August 6, 1945, at 8:15 am, the United States launched an atomic bomb over the city of Hiroshima, killing about 140,000 people. Three days later, an identical bomb hit Nagasaki and killed 74,000 more people, according to France-Presse (AFP) news agency. The two attacks, which precipitated the end of World War II (1939-1945), are the only cases in history in which nuclear weapons were used in war time. Representatives from 120 countries and regions, as well as from the European Union, are expected to attend the ceremony in Hiroshima tomorrow, a record number, according to the authorities of the city of southwest Japan. The main states with nuclear weapons, such as Russia, China and Pakistan, will not be present, while Iran, accused of trying to purchase the bomb, will be represented. Contrary to usual practice, Japan said it did not choose the guests for the ceremony, but notified all countries and regions of the event. "The existence of [politicians] leaders who want to reinforce military power to resolve conflict, including the possession of atomic weapons, makes the establishment of world peace difficult," Hiroshima Chamber of Hiroshi, Kazumi Matsui, said, referring to wars in Ukraine and the Middle East. Matsui invited last month the president of the United States to visit Hiroshima, when Donald Trump compared recent air attacks against Iran to atomic bombing of 1945. "It seems to me that he [Trump] does not quite understand the reality of atomic bombing, which, if used, cost many innocent citizens, friends or enemies, and threaten the survival of humanity," he said at the time. The war continues Hiroshima is currently a prosperous metropolis with 1.2 million inhabitants, but the ruins of a building topped by the metal skeleton of a summit remain in the city center as a recall of the horror of the attack. "It is important that many people gather in this city hit by the atomic bomb because the wars continue" in the world, said Toshiyuki Mimaki, co -president of the Nihon Hidankyo organization, formed by pump survivors and a 2024 Nobel Peace Prize winner. Nihon Hidankyo wants governments to take action to eliminate nuclear weapons, based on the testimonies of the survivors of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, known as 'Hibakusha'. “I want foreign representatives to visit the Memorial Peace Museum and understand what happened” under the atomic cloud in the form of mushroom, Mimaki said. "I believe the global trend to a world without nuclear weapons will continue. The younger generation is working hard to achieve it," said 80 -year -old Kunihiko Sakuma, who was 9 months old in 1945 and was three kilometers from the point of impact. Sakuma, who is expected to meet Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, after the ceremony, intends to appeal to Tokyo to add to the UN treaty about the prohibition of nuclear weapons, signed in 2017. Tokyo refused to sign the treaty, claiming that the objective is unattainable without the help of states with nuclear weapons.

item.title: Traffic | Counselor asks for prudence in the circulation to the north
item.description: After the Hong Kong executive announced that, from September, he will eliminate the appointment requirement to Raehk drivers to take the car to Guangdong, IP Wai Keong, a member of the Traffic Advisory Board, asked the Government of the Raem to consider a similar measure. The counselor argued, in statements to the newspaper Exmooo, that there is a contradiction between the economy of residential neighborhoods and the demand for consumption of residents. Despite the recovery of Gross Domestic Product for levels around 90 percent of the verified before the pandemic, if it is even easier for Macao residents to cross the car border, the local economy will suffer even more, especially in the northern area of the peninsula, also at the level of employment. In addition, IP Wai Keong has expressed doubts that the Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Bridge Border Post has the ability to respond to the increase in traffic produced by exempting the need for marking to cross the border in private cars.

item.title: Dirks Theater | NON -VERBAL THEATER WITH LINKS TO SARAMAGO
item.description:
It's called “Echoes in Dreams” and is the new nonverbal play of the local company Dirks Theater. Scheduled for September, this show mixes the compositions of Argentine José Luís Merlin, with body performances inspired by the Psychology and the tale “O Centauro”, by José Saramago
Macao Dirks Theater's theatrical company features, between September 19th and 21st, the show “Echoes in Dreams”, which constitutes a performance in which bodies wanders to the sound of the classic guitar, with sounds of Argentine José Luís Merlin, and expressions of nonverbal theater. The play is presented in the northern zone of the peninsula, namely in the space “Hiukok Laboratory, in number 408 of Rua dos Fishermen, specifically in the industrial building Nam Fong. According to information provided by the company, it mixes a “classic guitar, six strings, and three souls and bodies”, being a show that “will lead the public to observe human behavior from a perspective in the third person, plunging into themes such as physical and subconscious conflict, exploring the very understanding of 'identity'”. In this play there is also no shortage of influences from Portuguese literature, namely the Nobel Prize for literature José Saramago, with the tale “O Centauro”. It is a text that begins this way: “The horse stopped. The horseshoe-free hulls were signed in the round stones and slips that covered the almost dry bottom of the river. The man poured his hands, cautiously, the thorny branches that covered his vision to the side of the plain. “The centaur, an immortal prehistoric creature, half a man, half horse, feels blame for his race has been annihilated by humans while he could do nothing to prevent him. This hybrid creature has been wandered around the world since then, becoming a night figure just to stay away from all human species. last time. Jung is present In addition to the reference to Saramago, “Echoes in Dreams” will also seek inspiration from psychology, namely the work “Memories, Dreams, Reflections” by Swiss psychologist Carl Gustav Jung. On stage, Macao guitarist Bruce Chi Man Pun plays the compositions of José Luís Merlin, while actor Ka Man IP and dancer Chloe Wong "have a visual and emotionally evocative performance." "Echoes in Dreams" is about concepts such as "nostalgia", "contrast", "exile" and "happiness", narrating the inner world of "someone who lives in a certain city." It is also made, in the play, a reflection on the themes of “exile” and “belonging” in the contemporary global context. Tickets are on sale on the Dart Ticketing platform and cost 240 patacas, with discounts for those who buy tickets in advance and also for students and retired. “Echoes in Dreams” has already climbed the stage once, with another format. According to the company, what the public will see in September is a "small retrospective of the first" Echoes in Dreams "race." “It will not be the same as we did in 2023. The world has changed and we all move. Let's dance once again,” is mentioned.

item.title: SMG | Rain will extend today
item.description:
For the first time, this year, the black sign of heavy rain was issued and it is expected that precipitation will not continue to give respite in this day. Yesterday, the most intense rains registered at Dr. Sun Yat Sen Municipal Park and Coloane Village
Thunderstorms, sweeteners and unstable time. This was the forecast left by the Directorate of Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) for this day, after a morning with intense and quite thunder, which led to the emission of the first black signal of intense rain of the year. “Due to the combined influence of a southwest air stream and high altitude disturbances, time is expected to be unstable between Tuesday and the beginning of Wednesday (August 5-6), with frequent, sometimes intense, thunderstorm,” was explained on the SMG portal. "It is appealed to the population to pay attention to information and weather warnings, adjust their travel properly and pay attention to the possibility of flooding in low areas during heavy rain in a short time," he was added. Yesterday was marked by the most intense rain of the year, which was felt mainly in the morning. In some zones of the territory, the largest water loads felt between 5am and 6 am, especially in the northern part of the city, such as black sand, but rain has extended practically all day. As a consequence of bad weather, and water accumulation, the heaviest rainfall signal, the highest of the scale, was lifted around 8:18 am, with the forecast of floods in the low zones of the territory. This signal is issued when it is expected that in one hour precipitation reaches 80 millimeters of rain, ie the equivalent of 80 liters of water per square meter. Suspended classes The intense rain alert led any secondary school classes to be suspended in the morning, according to a statement from the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ). In the same vein, children's, primary and special teachings were suspended throughout the day. The Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) revealed that during the most intense rain period there was a need to assist a driver whose car suffered a malfunction on the Macao bridge. Around noon and a half, and at a time when the rain signs had been raised, the area to record the highest precipitation accumulation was the coloane village, with 118.6mms of rain from midnight. This zone recorded the largest rain around 8am, when it accumulated almost 60 millimeters of rain. According to SMG data, Dr. Sun Yat Sen Municipal Park, near the doors of the siege, was another one of the most affected places with 118.2 mm of rain. In this place, the most intense rain occurred at 6am. The Monte Fortress (109.2mm), the black sand (104.4mm) and Ka-Hó (104.4mm) were other areas where in 12 hours the accumulated rain exceeded 100 millimeters.

item.title: Heritage | Requested action to the government in building buildings
item.description:
Following the damage caused by Typhoon Whipa, the former Iam Chan Pou Sam counselor understands that the government should take a strong position in the management and maintenance of old buildings or historical interest. The official argues that the Kaiping model is followed in Macau in the Patio do Espinho
The passage of the first typhoon that led to the issuance of Alert Signal 10, Whipa led the honorary president of the Macao population and welfare promotion association, Chan Pou Sam, to warn of the need to change laws and regulations to ensure the integrity of the city's buildings, especially of the oldest and of equity interest. Speaking to the citizen newspaper, the former member of the Advisory Board of the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) gave the damage to facades of buildings, such as the new and luxurious Nova Grand, in the mud, but also the collapse of a wall in an old house in the courtyard of Espinho. The official considers that the government should improve the regulations governing private buildings, clarify the legal status of owners, oblige inspections and reparations of buildings and increase subsidies for the maintenance of buildings and boost a proactive attitude in the defense of the integrity of buildings. Chan Pou Sam states that many owners have an advanced age, are not instruction and do not comprise the laws and regulations on the maintenance of older buildings. The situation is aggravated in buildings where property rights are not clear, and that do not have associations of owners or any organization that deals with the maintenance of the building. As such, the leader considers essential that the executive assumes a more interventional role in defending the integrity of the city's urban park. Thorn According to official data, there are approximately 4,800 buildings in Macao over 30 years old, and more than 3,500 of these buildings are less than seven floors and are located in old neighborhoods. From this last sample, about 1,700 have aged structures, poor -wedy doors and windows, lack of fire protection, pipeline and ancient electric networks and precarious sanitation. In addition to the buildings that constitute a risk to public safety, Chan Pou Sam emphasizes the degradation of the homes of the Patio do Espinho (in the rear of the ruins of São Paulo), a place with a history of over 400 years, which deserves to be preserved for constituting a physical memory of Macao's “roots and soul”. Once the properties and management of real estate remains unchanged, the official thinks that the government should take responsibility for the conservation and revitalization of homes in the Patio do Espinho, following the example of the model adopted in the villages of Kaiping and Diaolou in Jiangmen. It should be noted that Chan Pou Sam has assumed positions of management in associations linked to the Jiangmen community and was the AMI counselor who suggested a public consultation to remove the “colonialist names” from the streets of Macao. At the time, the executive led by Chui Sai On, at the end of his second term, did not access the suggestion.

item.title: Economy | Academic one speaks at the end of contraction
item.description:
Henry Law considers that the economic crisis has come to an end and that gross domestic product should no longer suffer any contraction by the end of the year. At the real estate market, Law believes that good news can arrive if there is a reduction in the interest rate
The Associate Chief of the Department of Finance and Business Economics of the University of Macao (UM), Henry Lei Chun Kwok, considers that the economy of the territory is going through a recovery phase and that the decline of the first three months of the year is outdated. This is how the academic reacted to the growth of gross domestic product (GDP) of 5.1 percent in real terms in the second semester, compared to the same period. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, Henry Law pointed out that growth is justified mainly with increasing external demand. However, and despite the improvements, the academic warned of the need to track the possible risks for private consumption, investment and the impact of the devaluation of the real estate market. However, in relation to the price of real estate, Henry Lei acknowledged that there are possibilities that next month there are positive news, if the federal US bank chooses to reduce interest rates. Given that Pataca is indexed indirectly to the US dollar, the US interest rate will lead to the most capital available in Macau to invest and buy housing. Henry Lei also explained that a recovery of the real estate market is positive, as indirectly can promote activity in other sectors, such as new loans with banks, new housing remodeling works, and greater private consumption. Better distribution Alongside economic recovery, Henry Law warned the executive to the need to ensure better distribution of economic growth. Currently, law explained, growth gains are concentrated on what the leading industries claimed, as with game dealers. However, law pointed out that greater cooperation between the government, commercial associations and companies, which lead tourists to visit community neighborhoods and generate the growth of other businesses that are not directly linked to the game. For its part, the director of the UM UM Game Industry Institute, Davis Fong, trusts that game's revenues in the second half of the year will be over 20 billion patacas per month. The former deputy recalled that the revenues of the game have always been over 20 billion Patacas in the last three months, so the government should be questioned about what “did well in the last three months” and continue on this path. Regarding the closure of satellite casinos, Davis Fong predicts that the market will absorb the changes gradually. In addition, the academic has devalued the closing of satellite casinos because their weight in the game market has been decreasing in recent years, although recipes are growing. Fong also defended the closure of the satellite casinos indicating that it will contribute to consolidate the position of the dealers, lowering operating costs and increasing profits.

item.title: Zhongshan | New teams created to deepen cooperation
item.description:
New working groups are development in the context of cooperation mechanisms between Macau and Zhongshan and will work in areas such as “economy and trade”, “Biomedicine and Comprehensive Health”, “consumption safety”, “cultural and tourism”
Macau and Zhongshan will create seven new work teams under a regional cooperation program. The revelation was made during the latest meeting of the specific group to promote Zhongshan-Macau cooperation, which took place inside on Monday. According to the statement issued by the Secretary's Office for Economics and Finance, the new seven teams of cooperation will focus on the areas of “innovation”, “Economics and Commerce”, “Biomedicine and Comprehensive Health”, “Safety in Consumption”, “Cultural and Tourism”, “Transphronic Government Services” and “Qualified Tables”. The creation of these groups was justified with the desire to “promote greater effectiveness in bilateral cooperation”. Official information also indicates that the meeting served for both parties to make thematic presentations and exchange ideas on subjects such as the “Macao Drugs produced in Guangdong” or cooperation in the formation and importation of qualified frames. In addition, the direction of Zhongshan's development and renovation services, the Zhongshan Market Inspection Services Directors, and the Government of the Government's Consumer Council signed a cooperation agreement aimed at fostering consumer confidence in the products made available in both regions. The agreement will lead to the “bilateral construction of the‘ Certified Store ’brand” and involves “the evaluation and management of brands, the dissemination with the society and the exchange of information” about the available products. The polar star According to yesterday's press release of the Secretary's Office for Economics and Finance, Monday's meeting aimed at “implementing the spirit of President Xi Jinping's important speeches given during his Guangdong and Macao inspection visit” and “further promoting bilateral cooperation in domains”. The Macao government was represented by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, while Zhongshan was represented by the secretary of the Zhongshan Municipal Committee of the Chinese Communist Party, Guo Wenhai and the deputy secretary of the Zhongshan Municipal Committee of the Chinese Communist Party and interim municipal governor of Zhongshan, Yin Nianhong. At the meeting, Tai Kin IP highlighted the willingness to “continually deepen cooperation in the areas of Economics and Commerce, Biomedicine, Poor Technology, Culture and Tourism”.

item.title: Rain | HK alerts and more than 80,000 residents of Beijing removed from home
item.description:
China and Hong Kong have faced periods of heavy rainfall in recent days that have forced extra care and residents' travel. In the Chinese capital 82,000 people had to leave their homes, while in Hong Kong streets and a hospital suffered floods and some subway stations were closed
Strong rains continue not to give respite, not only in Macau (see page 7), but in Hong Kong and in the interior of the country. No caso da China, as autoridades de Pequim deslocaram mais de 82 mil pessoas de casa devido a chuvas torrenciais, uma semana após inundações mortais que levaram os responsáveis locais a reconhecer falhas na resposta, noticiou ontem a agência noticiosa oficial Xinhua. Thus, tens of thousands of residents were removed from the most affected areas by rain until 9 pm on Monday, local time, according to the Municipal Flood Response Center. The center warned of the high risk of floods in the districts of Miyun (northwest), Fangshan (southwest), lied (west) and Huairou (north). The Chinese capital kept in force the red alert-the highest-until yesterday morning, before predictions of heavy rain between Monday and the morning of Tuesday. Last week, these same rural districts north of Beijing were the most affected by the weather that caused 44 dead and nine missing, according to official data. Most of the deadly victims were registered in a home of elderly in Miyun. New measures in agriculture The severity of the catastrophe led municipal authorities to recognize “gaps” in the preparation of emergency services. Natural disasters are frequent in China during summer, with some regions subject to torrential rainfall and others to severe droughts. However, the Chinese authorities reinforced the device to respond to the adverse effects of intense rainfall and heat waves on agricultural cultures in various regions of the country, at a crucial time for autumn harvesting. Since the beginning of the rainy season, east and northern China areas have recorded episodes of extreme precipitation, while provinces such as Henan (Center) and Anhui (East) face prolonged periods of drought and high temperatures. This combination of meteorological phenomena represents a challenge for farmers, especially when about two months left to harvest the main autumn cereals, yesterday pointed out the Xinhua official news agency. In the province of Shaanxi (Center), where precipitation recently exceeded 100 millimeters in less than 24 hours, local authorities adopted preventive measures such as channel cleaning and reinforcement of dikes, which allowed much of the cultivated lands. However, Henan agricultural cooperatives affected by drought opted for gout watering systems and localized application of fertilizers to conserve moisture and minimize losses. Authorities have given priority to the rehabilitation of water infrastructure and the dissemination of efficient water management techniques in the absence of precipitation in some areas. The fall campaign represents a fundamental component of China's annual cereal production. In a statement issued yesterday, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs warned that weather conditions in the coming weeks will be determining and appealed to "all efforts to protect harvesting and strong support for the country's food security." Chinese President Xi Jinping said in 2023 that, although “1,400 million Chinese eat well” currently, “the food issue should not be careless”, stressing that the supply of food “is not an insignificant issue”. China has less than nine percent of the planet's aurable land, although it represents about 18 percent of the world's population. In the last summers, weather disasters have caused significant damage in the country: the 2023 scirred months were marked by flooding in Beijing, which caused more than 30 dead, while by 2022 several extreme and dried heat waves hit the center and east of China. Hong Kong on Alert With regard to the panorama of heavy rains in neighboring territory, they have not given respite either. According to public broadcaster RTHK, some hong Kong stations were closed yesterday due to the risk of flooding, given that the Hong Kong Observatory kept the black signal of storm [Black Rainestorm Warning Signal] until around 17 hours. Winds of about 110 kilometers per hour were recorded in some areas of the territory, and thunderstorms were also registered. The rthk channel also reveals that more than 10,800 lightnings were counted in the territory between midnight and 10 am yesterday, half of them occurred on Lantau Island. Until 11 am yesterday, the authorities responsible for the drainage systems recorded 21 episodes of flooding, and 180 emergency responses were made in 240 different locations. Highlight for the occurrence of an episode at Queen Mary Hospital this Tuesday, namely “on some roads” hospital access in Pok Fu Lam, and patients were displaced by firefighters to Ruttonjee Hospital in the Wanchai area. In some zones of the hospital the water reached the knees, and sand bags were placed to stop the flow of the rains. At about 11 am yesterday this scenario was resolved, with the normal one returning to the Queen Mary Hospital near noon. The rains also led to the large increase in water level in the Lower Shing Mun reservoir in the Shaan area, which led to the notification of nearby housing complexes, such as Mei Lam Estate, May Shing Court, Mei Chung Court and Granville Garden. Despite the heavy rains, some people went to work normally doing alternative routes. This was the case of Mak, a woman who, to the RTHK channel, said she had to make a deviation to get to the office. “I couldn't go straight to there and had to make a longer route. The metro [mtr] made some warnings [about the storm and closing], but I would like them to do them also inside the carriages, because I only realized that access was closed when I arrived on the way out,” he described. The sun Information provided by the Hong Kong Observatory speaks of the passage of an active "southwest monsoon and high altitude disturbances that are bringing heavy rainfall and violent thunderstorms to the southern coast of China and the northern part of the southern China Sea." Yesterday the highest daily precipitation record was broken to August since 1884, when 355.7 millimeters of precipitation at the Observatory's headquarters were registered. For today time should stay unstable in Hong Kong, with “heavy rains at the beginning” of the day. However, these "should gradually decrease" tomorrow, expected "a lot of heat with sunny periods in the next two days." Also the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) leave a heavy rain alert to this day with “frequent, sometimes intense, thunderstorm”. The sun is expected to start appearing at the MSAR from tomorrow, still with some clouds, extending this weather scenario until next Monday. Temperatures should reach 33 degrees.

item.title: FRC | Prominent handwriting on the show “Go ahead, the future shines”
item.description:
A new exhibition is inaugurated today at the Rui Cunha Foundation, which will be evident for a short time, until this Saturday. It is “go ahead, the future shines”, a show of handwriting whose protagonists are the students of the art and literature courses at the Fo Guang Shan Buddhist Center. This is a tribute to Master Hsing Yun
The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) hosts, between today and Saturday, a new exhibition of handwriting. This is the show “Keep Going, The Future Is Bright” [goes ahead, the future shines], with the organization of the teacher and students of the Fo Guang Shan Buddhist Center and Literature courses, and is presented as a tribute to the “Venerable Master” Hsing Yun. The show features about 50 works of calligraphy and Chinese painting “that seek to continue the spirit of Master Hsing Yun, founder of the Buddhist Center, whose vision problems would get worse in recent years,” describes a FRC note. item.title: Hong Kong | Financial support for 16 foreign activists prohibited
item.description: Sixteen Activists of Hong Kong, resident abroad, were yesterday targeted by sanctions from Hong Kong authorities, including cancellation of passports and banning access to financial support on suspicion of threat to national security. Yesterday's activistivists are part of a group of 19 people, targeted by July warrants, reported the Associated Press news agency. Hong Kong Security Secretary in China, Chris Tang, has banned funds or economic resources to 16 activists, including Victor Ho, Keung Ka-Wai, Australian student Chongyi Feng and US citizen Gong Sasha, according to Hong Kong government statement. The travel documents were canceled to 12 of the 16 Hong Kong passport holders. The Hong Kong government has also banned access to lease to 16 indicted, as well as commercial or business activity, stressing that any violation of orders is subject to a penalty of up to seven years in prison. The 16 activists are out of Hong Kong, and are accused of remaining involved in activities that endanger national security. The accusation also covers incitement to hatred against Beijing and Hong Kong, on the grounds of defamation and slander. item.title: Game | Morgan Stanley doubles the forecast of revenue growth
item.description: The gross revenues of Macao casinos during this year can approach the 248.9 billion patacas, according to the new estimate of investment bank analysts Morgan Stanley. In a statement released yesterday, analysts double the forecast of revenue growth of 5 percent in annual terms to 10 percent. The investment bank estimate for the margin of profits before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) tripled from a climb of 2 percent to 6 percent. item.description: Japan will mark on Wednesday the 80th anniversary of the launch of the atomic bomb over Hiroshima in a context of appeals to abandon nuclear weapons and wars in Ukraine and the Middle East. On August 6, 1945, at 8:15 am, the United States launched an atomic bomb over the city of Hiroshima, killing about 140,000 people. Three days later, an identical bomb hit Nagasaki and killed 74,000 more people, according to France-Presse (AFP) news agency. The two attacks, which precipitated the end of World War II (1939-1945), are the only cases in history in which nuclear weapons were used in war time. Representatives from 120 countries and regions, as well as from the European Union, are expected to attend the ceremony in Hiroshima tomorrow, a record number, according to the authorities of the city of southwest Japan. The main states with nuclear weapons, such as Russia, China and Pakistan, will not be present, while Iran, accused of trying to purchase the bomb, will be represented. Contrary to usual practice, Japan said it did not choose the guests for the ceremony, but notified all countries and regions of the event. "The existence of [politicians] leaders who want to reinforce military power to resolve conflict, including the possession of atomic weapons, makes the establishment of world peace difficult," Hiroshima Chamber of Hiroshi, Kazumi Matsui, said, referring to wars in Ukraine and the Middle East. Matsui invited last month the president of the United States to visit Hiroshima, when Donald Trump compared recent air attacks against Iran to atomic bombing of 1945. "It seems to me that he [Trump] does not quite understand the reality of atomic bombing, which, if used, cost many innocent citizens, friends or enemies, and threaten the survival of humanity," he said at the time. The war continues Hiroshima is currently a prosperous metropolis with 1.2 million inhabitants, but the ruins of a building topped by the metal skeleton of a summit remain in the city center as a recall of the horror of the attack. "It is important that many people gather in this city hit by the atomic bomb because the wars continue" in the world, said Toshiyuki Mimaki, co -president of the Nihon Hidankyo organization, formed by pump survivors and a 2024 Nobel Peace Prize winner. Nihon Hidankyo wants governments to take action to eliminate nuclear weapons, based on the testimonies of the survivors of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, known as 'Hibakusha'. “I want foreign representatives to visit the Memorial Peace Museum and understand what happened” under the atomic cloud in the form of mushroom, Mimaki said. "I believe the global trend to a world without nuclear weapons will continue. The younger generation is working hard to achieve it," said 80 -year -old Kunihiko Sakuma, who was 9 months old in 1945 and was three kilometers from the point of impact. Sakuma, who is expected to meet Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, after the ceremony, intends to appeal to Tokyo to add to the UN treaty about the prohibition of nuclear weapons, signed in 2017. Tokyo refused to sign the treaty, claiming that the objective is unattainable without the help of states with nuclear weapons.

item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: Zhao Gou (1107-1187), Emperor Gaozong (R.1127-62), lived the difficult time of recreation of the Song dynasty, when in 1127 his members were forced by the Jurchen nomades to abandon the capital Bianjing (current Kaifeng) towards the southern. Of these unsettling times with which the South Song (1127-1279) was started the escape itinerary made them pass through Nanjing, where they went to the current Shangqiu, then Yangzhou until they set a new capital in Linan (current Hangzhou) in 1129. Xiansheng Cilie (1115-1197), the Emperor's wife, or simply Song's Empress Wu who was, like he lover of the brush arts, recalled with bitterness in a brief poem: “Here beautiful plums are early and peach-winged by the wind,/ In the light of dusk, the Jade album in the vicent Celeste./ In Yangzhou I met the soft face of the spring breeze,/ comparing all the flowers, in general, nothing resembles the others. Everything, by the way, would be a little different. In the influence of neo-confutic philosophy, the reform of the society from the bottom up was now sought. Seeing painters' works, there will be a tendency to reduce the size of the paintings, abandoning the great scenarios with the large mountain visually dominating other smaller ones suggesting a order from above, and a closer form of representation emerges from more intimate scenes linked to everyday life. An example of this change is seen in the works of Su Hanchen (1094-1172), a painter of the Imperial Academy, sponsored by Gaozong's father, the inspired Emperor Huizong (1082-1135). In a painting made in a round range (Tuanshan) is a lady sitting in front of a parker in a garden (paint, color and gold on silk, 25.2 x 26.7 cm, at the Museum of Fine Arts of Boston). Seen from her back, her face appears in the mirror she holds in her right hand, stressing the fact that we are admiring a private moment. Su Hanchen would, however, be more recognized by two themes that would become genres within figurative painting. The scenes of children playing, Yingxi Tu, shown in different environments and bucket salespeople, Huolang Tu, transporting a huge paraphernalia of objects, usually cheap articles accessible to all. Both figures capable of provoking an unconstant joy. In two paintings that are at the National Palace Museum in Taipei (one of them, a vertical roller, ink and silk color, 181.5 x 267.3 cm) joins both themes, showing the street vendor welcomed by children from rich families. In a foreboding of what would come next. After all, with a smaller territory, the dynasty resumed in the south by Gaozong would be even more prosperous than in the north.
